arabicText: وَإِذَآ أَذَقْنَا ٱلنَّاسَ رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنۢ بَعْدِ ضَرَّآءَ مَسَّتْهُمْ إِذَا لَهُم مَّكْرٌۭ فِىٓ ءَايَاتِنَا ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَسْرَعُ مَكْرًا ۚ إِنَّ رُسُلَنَا يَكْتُبُونَ مَا تَمْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 We	 give	 mankind	 the	 taste	 of	
mercy	 after	 some	 hardship	 which	 had	
afflicted	 them,	 they	 immediately	 start	
conspiring	 against	 Our	 signs;	 proclaim,	
“The	 secret	 plan	 of	 Allah is	 the	 fastest”;	
indeed	Our	angels	record	your	scheming.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	hum	ādmiyoñ	ko	rahmat	ka	maza	
dete	 haiñ	 kisi	 taklif	 ke	 bad	 jo	 unheiñ	
pahuñchi	 thi	jabhi	woh	hamāri	āyatoñ	ke	
sāth	 dāoñ	 chalte	 haiñ	 tum	 farmādo	Allāh	
ki	 khufyā	 tadbir sab	 se	 jald	 ho	 jāti	 hai	
beshak	 Hamāre	 Firishte	 tumhāre	 makr	
likh	rahe	heiñ

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُسَيِّرُكُمْ فِى ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا كُنتُمْ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ وَجَرَيْنَ بِهِم بِرِيحٍۢ طَيِّبَةٍۢ وَفَرِحُوا۟ بِهَا جَآءَتْهَا رِيحٌ عَاصِفٌۭ وَجَآءَهُمُ ٱلْمَوْجُ مِن كُلِّ مَكَانٍۢ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ أُحِيطَ بِهِمْ ۙ دَعَوُا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ لَئِنْ أَنجَيْتَنَا مِنْ هَـٰذِهِۦ لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	transports	you	over	the	land	
and	 the	 sea;	 to	 the	 extent	 that	 when	 you	
are	in	ships	- and	the	ships	sail	with	them	
with	a	 favourable	breeze	and	they	rejoice	
at	it	- a	gust	of	strong	wind	reaches	them	
and	waves	come	 to	 them	 from	every	side	
and	they	realise	that	they	are	surrounded,	
- thereupon	 they	 pray	 to	 Allah as	 His	
sincere	 bondmen	 that,	 “If	 You	 rescue	 us	
from	this,	we	will	surely	be	thankful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	 hai	 ki	 tumheiñ	 khushki	 aur	 tari	
meiñ	 chalāta	 hai	 yahāñ	 tak	 ke	 jab	 tum	
kashti	 meiñ	 ho	 aur	 woh	 achi	 hawā	 se	
unheiñ	 le	 kar	 chaleiñ	 aur	 us	 par	 khush	
huwe	un	par	āañdhi	ka	jhokā	āayā	aur	har	
taraf	lehroñ	 ne	 unheiñ	 āaliyā	 aur	 samajh	
gaye	 ke	 hum	 ghir	 gaye	 us	 waqt	 Allāh	 ko	
pukārte	haiñ	nire	(khālis)	us	ke	bande	ho	
kar	ke	agar	 tu	is	se	hameiñ	bachā	legā	 to	
hum	zarur	shukr	guzār	hoñge.

arabicText: فَلَمَّآ أَنجَىٰهُمْ إِذَا هُمْ يَبْغُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۗ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّمَا بَغْيُكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِكُم ۖ مَّتَـٰعَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَنُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 when	 He	 rescues	 them,	 they	 start	
wrongfully	 committing	 oppression	 in	 the	
earth;	O	mankind!	Your	oppression	is	only	
a	 torment	 against	 yourselves;	 derive	 the	
benefit	 until	 you	 live	 in	 this	 world;	 you	
have	 then	 to	 return	 to	Us	 and	 thereupon	
We	shall	show	you	your	misdeeds.	
at	it	- a	gust	of	strong	wind	reaches	them	
and	waves	come	 to	 them	 from	every	side	
and	they	realise	that	they	are	surrounded,	
- thereupon	 they	 pray	 to	 Allah as	 His	
sincere	 bondmen	 that,	 “If	 You	 rescue	 us	
from	this,	we	will	surely	be	thankful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	Allāh	jab	unheiñ	bachā	leta	hai	jabhi	
woh	 zameen	 meiñ	 nā	 haq	 ziyādti	 karne	
lagte	 haiñ	 aye	 logo	 tumhāri	 ziyādti	
tumhāri	 hi	 jānoñ	 ka	 wabāl	 hai	 dunyā	 ke	
jite	 ji	 barat	 lo	 (fāidāh	 uthā	 lo)	 phir	
tumheiñ	 hamāri	 taraf	 phirnā	 hai	 us	waqt	
hum	tumheiñ	jatā	deñge	jo	tumhāre	kotak	
(kartoot)	the

arabicText: إِنَّمَا مَثَلُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمُ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ زُخْرُفَهَا وَٱزَّيَّنَتْ وَظَنَّ أَهْلُهَآ أَنَّهُمْ قَـٰدِرُونَ عَلَيْهَآ أَتَىٰهَآ أَمْرُنَا لَيْلًا أَوْ نَهَارًۭا فَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا حَصِيدًۭا كَأَن لَّمْ تَغْنَ بِٱلْأَمْسِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لِقَوْمٍۢ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. The	 example	 of	 the	 life	 of	 this	 world	 is	
similar	to	the	water	which	We	sent	down	
from	 the	 sky,	 so	 due	 to	 it	 the	 earth’s	
vegetation	 grew	 in	 abundance	 - that	
which	 men	 and	 cattle	 eat;	 to	 the	 extent	
that	 when	 the	 earth	 has	 taken	 on	 her	
ornaments	and	is	well	 beautified,	and	 her	 owners	 thought	 that	it	is	within	 their	 control,	Our	
command	 came	 to	 it	 at	 night	 or	 at	 day	 - so	 We	 made	 it	 harvested	 as	 if	 it	 had	 not	 existed	
yesterday;	this	is	how	We	explain	the	verses	for	the	people	who	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Dunyā	 ki	 zindagi	 ki kahāwat	 to	aeysi	 hi	 hai	jaise	woh	 pāni	 ke	 hum	 ne	āasmān	 se	 utārā	 to	 us	
sabab	zameen	se	ugne	wāli	chizeñ	ghani	(ziyādah)	ho	kar	nikleñ	jo	kuch	āadmi	aur	chaupāye	
khāte	haiñ	 yahāñ	 tak	 ke	jab	zameen	ne	apna	 singār	le	liyā	aur	 khoob	ārāsta	ho	gai	aur	us	 ke	
mālik	samjhe	ke	yeh	hamāre	bas	meiñ	āgayi	hamārā	hukm	us	par	āayā	rāt	meiñ	ya	din	meiñ	to	
hum	ne	use	kar	diyā	kāti	hui	goyā	kal	 thi	hi	nahiñ	hum	yooñ	hi	āyateiñ	mufassal	bayān	karte	
heiñ	ghaur	karne	wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ يَدْعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ دَارِ ٱلسَّلَـٰمِ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: . And	Allah calls	to	the	abode	of	peace,	and	guides	whomever	He	wills	on	the	Straight	Path
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Allāh	salāmati	ke	ghar	ki	taraf	pukārtā	hai	aur	jise	chāhe	seedhi	rāh	chalātā	hai

arabicText: ۞ لِّلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ وَزِيَادَةٌۭ ۖ وَلَا يَرْهَقُ وُجُوهَهُمْ قَتَرٌۭ وَلَا ذِلَّةٌ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
For	 the	 people	 of	 virtue,	is	goodness	and	
more	 than	 that;	 and	 neither	 will	 the	
blackness	 nor	 disgrace	 come	 upon	 their	
faces;	 it	 is	 they	 who	 are	 the	 people	 of	
Paradise;	they	will	abide	in	it	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bhalāi	wāloñ	ke	liye	bhalā	hai	aur	is	se	bhi	
zāid	 aur	 un	 ke	 muñh	 par	 na	 chadhegi	
siyāhi	 aur	 na	 khuwāri	 wohi	 Jannat	 wāle	
haiñ	woh	us	meiñ	hamesha	raheñge.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَسَبُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ جَزَآءُ سَيِّئَةٍۭ بِمِثْلِهَا وَتَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌۭ ۖ مَّا لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِنْ عَاصِمٍۢ ۖ كَأَنَّمَآ أُغْشِيَتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ قِطَعًۭا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مُظْلِمًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 (for)	 those	 who	 earned	 evil	 *,	 the	
recompense	 of	 evil	 is	 equal	 to	 it	 - and	
disgrace	 will	 come	 upon	 them;	 they	 will	
have	no	one	to	save	them	from	Allah;	as	if	
their	 faces	are	covered	with	pieces	of	 the	
dark	night;	it	is	they	who	are	the	people	of	
the	 fire;	 they	 will	 remain	in	it	 forever.	(*	
The	disbelievers.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jinhoñ	 ne	 burāiyān	 kamāiñ	 to	 burāi	
ka	 badlā	 usi	 jaisa	 aur	 un	 par	 zillat	
chadhegi	 unheiñ	 Allāh	 se	 bachāne	 wālā	
koi	 na	 hogā	 goyā	 un	 ke	 chehroñ	 par	
andheri	 rāt	 ke	 tukde	 chadha	 diye	 haiñ	
wohi	 dozakh	 wāle	 haiñ	 woh	 us	 meiñ	
hamesha	raheñ	ge

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُهُمْ جَمِيعًۭا ثُمَّ نَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ مَكَانَكُمْ أَنتُمْ وَشُرَكَآؤُكُمْ ۚ فَزَيَّلْنَا بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ شُرَكَآؤُهُم مَّا كُنتُمْ إِيَّانَا تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	on	the	day	when	We	raise	all	of	them	
together,	then	say	to	the	polytheists,	“Stay	
in	your	place	- you	and	your	partners (false	
deities)”;	 so	 We	 shall	 separate	 them	 from	
the	believers,	and	their	partners	will	say	to	
them,	“When	did	you	ever	worship	us!?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	hum	un	sab	ko	uthāyeñge	phir	
mushrikoñ	 se	 farmāyeñ	 ge	 apni	 jagah	
raho	 tum	 aur	 tumhāre	 sharik	 to	 hum	
unheiñ	 Musalmānoñ	 se	 judā	 kar	 deñge	
aur	 un	 ke	 sharik	 un	 se	 kaheñge	 tum	
hameiñ	kab	poojte	the

arabicText: فَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ شَهِيدًۢا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمْ إِن كُنَّا عَنْ عِبَادَتِكُمْ لَغَـٰفِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	 Allah suffices	 as	 a	 Witness	
between	 us	 and	 you,	 that	 we	 were	 not	
even	aware	that	you	worshipped	us!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 Allāh	 gawāh	 kāfi	 hai	 hum	 meiñ	 aur	
tum	 meiñ	 ke	 Hameiñ	 tumhāre	 poojne	 ki	
khabar	bhi	na	thi

arabicText: هُنَالِكَ تَبْلُوا۟ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ مَّآ أَسْلَفَتْ ۚ وَرُدُّوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَوْلَىٰهُمُ ٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Here	will	every	soul	come	to	know	what	it	
has	sent	ahead,	and	they	will	be	returned	
to	Allah - their	 true	Master,	and	 they	will	
lose	all	that	they	used	to	fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahāñ	har	jān	janch	legi	jo	āage	bhejā	aur	
Allāh	 ki	 taraf	 phere	 jāyeñ	 ge	 jo	 un	 ka	
sacha	maula	aur	un	ki	sāri	banawateñ	un	
se	gum	ho	jāyeñgi.

arabicText: قُلْ مَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أَمَّن يَمْلِكُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَمَن يُخْرِجُ ٱلْحَىَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَيِّتِ وَيُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَيِّتَ مِنَ ٱلْحَىِّ وَمَن يُدَبِّرُ ٱلْأَمْرَ ۚ فَسَيَقُولُونَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ فَقُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	(O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“Who	provides	
you	 sustenance	 from	 the	 sky	 and	 the	
earth?	 Or	 Who	 is	 the	 Owner	 of	 the	 ears	
and	 the	eyes?	And	Who	 brings	 forth	 the	living	 from	 the	 dead	and	Who	 brings	 forth	 the	 dead	
from	the	living?	And	Who	plans	all	matters?”	So	they	will	now	say,	“Allah”;	therefore	say,	“Then	
why	do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	 farmāo	 tumheiñ	 kaun	 rozi	 detā	 hai	
āasmān	Aur	zameen	se	ya	kaun	mālik	hai	
kān	aur	ānkhoñ	kā	aur	kaun	nikālta	hai	zinda	ko	murde	se	aur	kaun	nikālta	hai	murda	ko	zinde	
se	aur	 kaun	 tamām	 kamoñ	 ki	 tadbir	 kartā	 hai	 to	ab	 kaheñge	 ke	Allāh	 to	 tum	 farmāo	 to	 kyuñ	
nahiñ	darte

arabicText: فَذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَاذَا بَعْدَ ٱلْحَقِّ إِلَّا ٱلضَّلَـٰلُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصْرَفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	such	is	Allah,	your	True	Lord;	therefore	what	remains	after	the	truth,	except	error?	So	where	
are	you	reverting?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	yeh	Allāh	hai	tumhārā	sachā	Rab	phir	haq	ke	b’ad	kyā	hai	magar	gumrāhi	phir	kahāñ	phire	
jāte	ho

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ حَقَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ فَسَقُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: This	is	how	the	Word	of	your	Lord	is	proved	concerning	the	sinful,	so	they	will	not	believe
romanUrduTranslationText: Yuñ	hi	sābit	ho	chuki	hai	tere	Rab	ki	bāt	fāsiqoñ	par	to	woh	Imān	nahiñ	lāyeñge.

arabicText: قُلْ هَلْ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤْفَكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	 “Is	 there	 any	 one	 among	 your	
partners	(false	deities)	that	can	create	 for	
the	first	time	and	then	after	its	extinction,	
create	 it	 again?”	 Proclaim,	 “Allah creates	
for	 the	 first	 time	 and	 then	 after	 its	
extinction,	creates	it	again	- so	where	are	
you	reverting?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo	 tumhāre	 shārikoñ	 meiñ	 koi	
aeysa	 hai	 ke	 awwal	 banāye	 phir	 fanā	 ke	
bād	 do	 barā	 banāye	 tum	 farmāo	 Allāh	
awwal	 banātā	 hai	 phir	 fanā	 ke	 bād	 do	
barā	banāye	ga	to	kahāñ	auñdhe	jāte	ho?

arabicText: قُلْ هَلْ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ قُلِ ٱللَّهُ يَهْدِى لِلْحَقِّ ۗ أَفَمَن يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلْحَقِّ أَحَقُّ أَن يُتَّبَعَ أَمَّن لَّا يَهِدِّىٓ إِلَّآ أَن يُهْدَىٰ ۖ فَمَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	 “Is	 there	 any	 among	 your	 partners	
that	 shows	 the	 right	 path?”	 Say,	 “Allah
shows	 the	 right	 path;	 so	 who	 should	 be	
obeyed	 - the	 One	 Who	 shows	 the right	
path,	 or	 one	 who	 does	 not	 even	 find	 the	
right	 path	 unless	 he	 is	 guided?	 So	 what	
has	 happened	 to	 you?	 What	 sort	 of	 a	
judgement	you	impose!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	 farmāo	 tumhāre	 shārikoñ	 meiñ	 koi	
aeysa	 hai	 ke	 Haq	 ki	 rāh	 dikhāye	 tum	
farmāo	ke	Allāh	haq	ki	rāh	dikhāta	hai	to	
kyā	jo	haq	ki	rāh	dikhāye	us	ke	hukm	par	
chalnā	chāhiye	yā	us	ke	jo	khud	hi	rāh	na	
pāye	 jab	 tak	 rāh	 na	 dikhāyā	 jaye	 to	
tumheiñ	kyā	huwā	kaisa	hukm	lagāte	ho

arabicText: وَمَا يَتَّبِعُ أَكْثَرُهُمْ إِلَّا ظَنًّا ۚ إِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ شَيْـًٔا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	most	of	 them	do	not	 follow	anything	
except	 assumptions;	 indeed	 assumption	
does	not	serve	the	least	purpose	(in	place)	
of	 the	 truth;	 indeed	 Allah knows	 their	
deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	aksar	 to	nahiñ	chalte	magar	
gumān	 par	 beshak	 gumān	 haq	 kā	 kuch	
kām	 nahiñ	 deta	 beshak	 Allāh	 un	 ke	
kāmoñ	ko	jāntā	hai

arabicText: وَمَا كَانَ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانُ أَن يُفْتَرَىٰ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَـٰكِن تَصْدِيقَ ٱلَّذِى بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَتَفْصِيلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ مِن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 this	 noble	 Qur’an	 is	 not	 such	 that	
anyone	 can	 invent	 it,	 without	 Allah
revealing	it	- but	it	surely	is	a	confirmation	
of	 the	 Books	 preceding	 it	 and	 is	 an	
explanation	 of	 all	 that	 is	 written	 on	 the	
(preserved)	tablet	- there	is	no	doubt	in	it	-
it	is	from	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 is	 Qur’ān	 ki	 yeh	 Shān	 nahiñ	 ke	 koi	
apni	taraf	se	banā	le	be	Allāh	ke	utāre	hāñ	
woh	 agli	 kitāboñ	 ki	 tasdiq	 aur	lauh	meiñ	
jo	kuch	likhā	sab	ki	tafsil	hai	is	meiñ	kuch	
shak	 nahiñ	 Parwardigār-e-Ālam	 ki	 taraf	
se	hai

arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ ۖ قُلْ فَأْتُوا۟ بِسُورَةٍۢ مِّثْلِهِۦ وَٱدْعُوا۟ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
What!	 They	 dare	 say	 that	 “He	 has	
fabricated	 it”?	 Say,	 “Then	 bring	 one	
chapter	 like	 it	 and,	 other	 than	Allah,	 call	
everyone	you	can	if	you	are	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	yeh	kehte	haiñ	unhoñ	ne	ise	banā	liyā	
hai	tum	farmāo	to	is	jaisi	ek	soorat	le	āao	
aur	Allāh	ko	chod	kar	jo	mil	sakeñ	sab	ko	
bulā	lāo	agar	tum	sache	ho

arabicText: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِمَا لَمْ يُحِيطُوا۟ بِعِلْمِهِۦ وَلَمَّا يَأْتِهِمْ تَأْوِيلُهُۥ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	contrary,	they	denied	the	thing	the	knowledge	of	which	they	could	not	master,	whereas	
they	have	not	yet	seen	its	outcome;	similarly	those	before	them	had	denied,	therefore	see	what	
sort	of	fate	befell	the	unjust!
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Balke	use	jhutlayā	jis	ke	‘ilm	par	qāboo	na	pāyā	aur	abhi	unhoñ	ne	us	ka	anjām	nahiñ	dekha	hai	
aeyse	hi	un	se	agloñ	ne	jhutlayā	thā	to	dekho	zālimoñ	kā	anjām	kaisa	huwā

arabicText: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يُؤْمِنُ بِهِۦ وَمِنْهُم مَّن لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِهِۦ ۚ وَرَبُّكَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	 them	is	 one	who	accepts	 faith	in	it,	and	among	 them	is	 one	who	does	not	accept	
faith	in	it;	and	your	Lord	well	knows	the	mischievous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	un	meiñ	koi	is	par	Imān	lātā	aur	koi	is	par	Imān	nahiñ	lātā	hai	aur	tumhārā	Rab	mufsidoñ	
(fasād	karne	wāloñ)	ko	khoob	jāntā	hai.

arabicText: وَإِن كَذَّبُوكَ فَقُل لِّى عَمَلِى وَلَكُمْ عَمَلُكُمْ ۖ أَنتُم بَرِيٓـُٔونَ مِمَّآ أَعْمَلُ وَأَنَا۠ بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 if	 they	 deny	 you,	 say,	 “For	 me	 are	 my	 deeds,	 and	 for	 you	 are	 your	 deeds;	 you	 have	 no	
concern	with	what	I	do,	and	I	have	no	relation	with	what	you	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	agar	woh	tumheiñ	jhutlāyeñ	to	farmā	do	ke	mere	liye	meri	karni	aur	tumhāre	liye	tumhāri	
karni	tumheiñ	mere	kām	se	ilāqa	(t’alluq)	nahiñ	aur	mujhe	tumhāre	kām	se	t’alluq	nahiñ

arabicText: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَسْتَمِعُونَ إِلَيْكَ ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ وَلَوْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And among	them	are	some	who	listen	to	you;	so	will	you	make	the	deaf	hear	even	if	they	do	not	
have	any	sense?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 un	meiñ	 koi	woh	 haiñ	jo	 tumhāri	 taraf	 kān	lagāte	 haiñ	 to	 kyā	 tum	 behroñ	 ko	 sunā	 doge	
agarche	unheiñ	aql	na	ho

arabicText: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَنظُرُ إِلَيْكَ ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تَهْدِى ٱلْعُمْىَ وَلَوْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	them	is	one	who	gazes	at	you;	
so	will	 you	guide	 the	 blind	 *	even	if	 they	
cannot	 perceive?	 (* Deaf or blind to 
guidance.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	koi	tumhāri	taraf	taktā	hai	to	
kyā	 tum	 andhoñ	 ko	 rāh	 dikhā	 doge	
agarche	woh	na	soojheñ	(na	dekh	sakeñ)

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَظْلِمُ ٱلنَّاسَ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. Indeed	Allah does	not	oppress	men	at	all,	
but	they	do	wrong	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Beshak	 Allāh	 logoñ	 par	 kuch	 zulm	 nahiñ	
kartā	hāñ log	hi	apni	jānoñ	par	zulm	karte	
haiñ

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ كَأَن لَّمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا سَاعَةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلنَّهَارِ يَتَعَارَفُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ قَدْ خَسِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِلِقَآءِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُهْتَدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 on	 the	 day	 when	He	 will	 raise	 all	 of	
them	together,	as	if	they	had	never	stayed	
on	earth	except	 for	a	moment	 during	 the	
day,	 they	 will	 recognise	 one	 another;	 for	
completely	 ruined	 are	 those	 who	 denied	
the	 meeting	 with	 Allah and	 were	 not	 on	
guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jis	 din	 unheiñ	 uthāyega	 goyā	 dunyā	
meiñ	na	rahe	the	magar	us	din	ki	ek	ghari	
āpas	meiñ	pahchān	kareñ	ge	poore	ghāte	
meiñ	 rahe	 woh	 jinhoñ	 ne	 Allāh	 se	 milne	
ko	jhutlāyā	aur	hidāyat	par	na	the

arabicText: وَإِمَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى نَعِدُهُمْ أَوْ نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ ثُمَّ ٱللَّهُ شَهِيدٌ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 whether	 We	 show	 you	 (O	 dear	
Prophet	Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	
be	 upon	 him)	 part	 of	 what	 We	 promise	
them	or	whether	We	call	you	 towards	Us	
before	it	- in	any	case	they	have	to	return	
to	 Us	- then	Allah is	 the	Witness	 of	 their	
deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	hum	tumheiñ	dikhā	deiñ	kuch	us	
meiñ	 se	jo	 unheiñ	w’adā	 de	 rahe	 haiñ	 yā	
tumheiñ	 pehle	 hi	 apne	 pās	 bulā	 leiñ	 bahar	 hāl	 unheiñ	 hamāri	 taraf	 palatkar	 ānā	
hai	phir	Allāh	gawāh	hai	un	ke	kāmoñ	par.

arabicText: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ رَّسُولٌۭ ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ رَسُولُهُمْ قُضِىَ بَيْنَهُم بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 in	 every	 nation	 was	 a	 Noble	
Messenger	 (from	 Allah);	 so	 when	 their	
Noble	Messenger	came	to	them,	they	were	
judged	 with	 fairness,	 and	 they	 were	 not	
wronged
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	har	ummat	meiñ	ek	Rasool	huwā	jab	
unka	Rasool	unke	pās	āatā	un	par	insāf	ka	
faislā	 kar	 diya	 jāta	 aur	 un	 par	 zulm	 na	
hota

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 say,	 “When	 will	 this	 promise	
come,	if	you	are	truthful?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kehte	haiñ	yeh	wadā	kab	āye	ga	agar	
tum	sache	ho

arabicText: قُل لَّآ أَمْلِكُ لِنَفْسِى ضَرًّۭا وَلَا نَفْعًا إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۗ لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۚ إِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ سَاعَةًۭ ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	 “I	 have	 no	 autonomy	 to	 benefit	 or	
hurt	myself,	except	what	Allah wills	*;	for	
every	 nation	 is	 a	 fixed	 promise;	 when	
their	 promise	 comes,	 they	 cannot	 postpone	 it	 nor	 can	 they	 advance	 it	 one	 moment.	 (*	 To	
empower	me.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	 farmāo	maiñ	apni	jān	ke	bhale	bure	
kā	 źati	 ikhtiyār	 nahiñ	 rakhtā	 magar	 jo	
Allāh	chāhe	har	giroh	ka	ek	w’adā	hai	jab	
unka	 w’adā	 āaye	 ga	 to	 ek	 ghari	 na	 piche	
hateñ	na	āage	badheñ

arabicText: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَتَىٰكُمْ عَذَابُهُۥ بَيَـٰتًا أَوْ نَهَارًۭا مَّاذَا يَسْتَعْجِلُ مِنْهُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“What	is	your	opinion	- if	His	punishment	comes	upon	you	at	night	or	during	 the	day,	so	
what	is	there	in	it	for	which	the	guilty	are	being	hasty?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	bhalā	batāo	to	agar	us	kā	‘azāb	tum	par	rāt	ko	āye	yā	din	ko	to	us	meiñ	woh	kaunsi	
chiz	hai	ke	mujrimoñ	ko	jis	ki	jaldi	hai

arabicText: أَثُمَّ إِذَا مَا وَقَعَ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦٓ ۚ ءَآلْـَٔـٰنَ وَقَدْ كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	 you	 believe	it	 only	when	it	 has	 occurred?	What!	 You	 believe	in	it	 now,	whereas	 you	
were	impatient	*	for	it	before?	(*	Eagerly	demanding	for	it	to	occur.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā	jab	ho	pade	gā	us	waqt	us	kā	yaqin	karoge	kyā	ab	mānte	ho	pahle	 to	is	ki	jaldi	machā	
rahe	the

arabicText: ثُمَّ قِيلَ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلْخُلْدِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	the	unjust	will	be	told,	“Taste	the	punishment	 forever;	and	you	will	be	repaid	only	what	
you	used	to	earn.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	zālimoñ	se	kahā	jāyegā	hameshā	kā	‘azāb	chakho	tumheiñ	kuch	aur	badlā	na	mile	gā	magar	
wohi	jo	kamāte	the

arabicText: ۞ وَيَسْتَنۢبِـُٔونَكَ أَحَقٌّ هُوَ ۖ قُلْ إِى وَرَبِّىٓ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّۭ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	ask	you	“Is	it	a	reality	*?”	Say,	“Yes,	by	oath	of	my	Lord,	indeed	surely	it	is	a	reality,	
and	you	will	not	be	able	to	escape.”	(*	The	punishment	of	the	hereafter.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	 se	 poochte	 haiñ	 kyā	 woh	Haq	 hai	 tum	 farmāo	 hāñ	mere	 Rab	 ki	 qasam	 beshak	 woh	
zaroor	haq	hai	aur	tum	kuch	thakā	na	sakoge

arabicText: وَلَوْ أَنَّ لِكُلِّ نَفْسٍۢ ظَلَمَتْ مَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لَٱفْتَدَتْ بِهِۦ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّدَامَةَ لَمَّا رَأَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۖ وَقُضِىَ بَيْنَهُم بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۚ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	each	unjust	soul	owned	everything	
that	is	in	the	earth,	it	would	have	certainly	
given	it	in	order	to	redeem	itself;	and	they	
secretly	felt	repentant	when	they	saw	the	
punishment;	 and	 it	 has	 been	 judged	
between	them	with	fairness	and	they	will	
not	be	wronged.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 har	 zālim	 jān	 zameen	 meiñ	 jo	
kuch	 hai	 sab	 ki	mālik	 hoti	 zarur	apni	jān	
chudāne	 meiñ	 deti	 aur	 dil	 meiñ	 chupke	
chupke	 pashemāñ	 huwe	 jab	 ‘azāb	 dekhā	
aur	 un	meiñ	insāf	 se	 faislā	 kar	 diya	 gayā	
aur	un	par	zulm	na	hogā.

arabicText: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Pay	heed!	Indeed	everything	that	is	in	the	
heavens	 and	 the	 earth	 belongs	 only	 to	
Allah;	pay	heed!	Indeed	Allah’s	promise	is	
true,	but	most	of	them	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sun	 lo	 beshak	 Allāh	 hi	 kā	 hai	 jo	 kuch	
āsmānoñ	 meiñ	 hai	 aur	 zameen	 meiñ	 sun	
lo	beshak	Allāh	kā	w’adā	sachā	hai	magar	
un	meiñ	aksar	ko	khabar	nahiñ.

arabicText: هُوَ يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 He	 gives	 life	 and	 gives	 death,	 and	
towards	Him	you	will	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Woh	 jilātā	 aur	 mārtā	 hai	 aur	 usi	 ki	 taraf	
phiroge

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ قَدْ جَآءَتْكُم مَّوْعِظَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَشِفَآءٌۭ لِّمَا فِى ٱلصُّدُورِ وَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةٌۭ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. O	 mankind!	 The	 advice	 has	 come	 to	 you	
from	your	Lord	and	a	cure	for	the	hearts	-
and	guidance	and	mercy	for	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aye	 logoñ	 tumhāre	 pās	 tumhāre	 Rab	 ki	
taraf	se	nasihat	āayi	aur	diloñ	ki	sehat	aur	
hidāyat	aur	rahmat	Imān	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: قُلْ بِفَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَبِرَحْمَتِهِۦ فَبِذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَفْرَحُوا۟ هُوَ خَيْرٌۭ مِّمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	 “Upon	Allah’s	 munificence	 and	 upon	
His	mercy	- upon	these	should	the	people	
rejoice”;	that	is	better	than	all	their	wealth	
and	possessions.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo	 Allāh	 hi	 ke	 fazl	 aur	 usi	 ki	
rahmat	 aur	 usi	 par	 chahiye	 ke	 khushi	
kareiñ	 woh	 un	 ke	 sab	 dhan	 daulat	 se	
behtar	hai

arabicText: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُم مِّن رِّزْقٍۢ فَجَعَلْتُم مِّنْهُ حَرَامًۭا وَحَلَـٰلًۭا قُلْ ءَآللَّهُ أَذِنَ لَكُمْ ۖ أَمْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	 “What	 is	 your	 opinion	 - (regarding)	
the	 sustenance	 that	 Allah has	 sent	 down	
for	 you?	 So	 you	 have,	 on	 your	 own,	
deemed	 lawful	 and	 unlawful	 in	 it!”;	 say,	
“Has	Allah given	you	permission	 for	it,	or	
do	you	fabricate	a	lie	against	Allah?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo	to	bhalā	batāo	to	jo	Allāh	ne	
tumhāre	 liye	 rizq	 utārā	 us	 meiñ	 tum	 ne	
apni	 taraf	 se	 Harām-o-Halāl	 thehrā	 liyā	
tum	 farmāo	 kyā	 Allāh	 ne	 is	 ki	 tumheiñ	
ijāzat	di	yā	Allāh	par	jhoot	bāñdhte	ho.

arabicText: وَمَا ظَنُّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 what	 do	 they,	 who	 fabricate	 lies	
against	 Allah,	 assume	 will	 be	 their	 state	 on	 the	 Day	 of	 Resurrection?	 Indeed	 Allah is	 Most	
Munificent	upon	mankind,	but	most	people	are	not	thankful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	gumān	hai	un	kā	jo	Allāh	par	jhoot	bāndhte	haiñ	ke	Qiyāmat	meiñ unka	kyā	hāl	hoga	
beshak	Allāh	logoñ	par	fazl	kartā	hai	magar	aksar	log	shukr	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: وَمَا تَكُونُ فِى شَأْنٍۢ وَمَا تَتْلُوا۟ مِنْهُ مِن قُرْءَانٍۢ وَلَا تَعْمَلُونَ مِنْ عَمَلٍ إِلَّا كُنَّا عَلَيْكُمْ شُهُودًا إِذْ تُفِيضُونَ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَا يَعْزُبُ عَن رَّبِّكَ مِن مِّثْقَالِ ذَرَّةٍۢ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَلَآ أَصْغَرَ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكْبَرَ إِلَّا فِى كِتَـٰبٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	 whatever	 work	 you	(O	 dear	 Prophet	Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 are	
engaged	 in	 and	 recite	 a	 part	 of	 the	 Qur’an	 from	 Him,	 and	 whatever	 you	 people	 do,	 We	 are	
Witness	upon	you	from	the	time	you	begin	it;	and	there	is	nothing	in	the	earth	or	in	the	heaven	
worth	 the	 weight	 of	 the	 smallest	 particle	 hidden	 from	 your	 Lord,	 nor anything	 smaller	 or	
greater	than	it,	which	is	not	recorded	in	a	clear	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	kisi	kām	meiñ	ho	aur	us	ki	taraf	se	kuch	Qur'ān	padho	aur	tum	log	koi	kām	karo	hum	
tum	par	gawāh	hote	haiñ	jab	tum	us	ko	shuru’	karte	ho	aur	tumhāre	Rab	se	źarrāh	bhar	koi	chiz	
ghāib	 nahiñ	 zameen	meiñ	 nā	 āasmān	meiñ	 aur	 nā	is	 se	 choti	 aur	 nā	is	 se	 badi	 koi	 chiz	jo	 ek	
roushan	kitāb	meiñ	nā	ho

arabicText: أَلَآ إِنَّ أَوْلِيَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Pay	 heed!	 Indeed	 upon	 the	 friends	 of	
Allah is	 neither	 any	 fear,	 nor	 any	 grief.	
(The	 friends	 of	 Allah are	 the	 best	 in	 the	
creation.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sun	 lo	 beshak	 Allāh	 ke	 waliyoñ	 par	 na	
kuch	khauf	hai	na	kuch	gham.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 have	 accepted	 faith	 and	
practice	piety.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	 Imān	laye	aur	 parhez-gari	 karte	
haiñ	.

arabicText: لَهُمُ ٱلْبُشْرَىٰ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ لَا تَبْدِيلَ لِكَلِمَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
There	 are	 good	 tidings	 for	 them	 in	 the	
life	 of	 this	 world	 and	 in	 the	 Hereafter;	
the	Words	of	Allah cannot	change;	this	is	
the	supreme	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Unheiñ khushkhabri	 hai	 dunyā	 ki	
zindagi	 meiñ	 aur	 ākhirat	 meiñ	 Allāh	 ki	
bāteiñ	 badal	 nahiñ	 saktiñ	 yahi	 badi	
kāmyābi	hai.

arabicText: وَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّ ٱلْعِزَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًا ۚ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 grieve	 at	 their	 speech	 (O	
dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	 and	
blessings	 be	 upon	 him);	 indeed	 all	
honour	 is	 for	 Allah and	 He	 is	 the	 All	
Hearing,	the	All	Knowing.	
the	supreme	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	 un	 ki	 bātoñ	 ka	 gham	 na	 karo	
beshak	 izzat	 sari	 Allāh	 ke	 liye	 hai	 wohi	
suntā	jāntā	hai.

arabicText: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَمَا يَتَّبِعُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَخْرُصُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 all	 those	 in	 the	 heavens	 and	 all	
those	in	the	earth	are	in	Allah’s	control;	
and	 what	 do	 those	 who	 pray	 to	 the	
partners	 instead	 of	 Allah,	 follow?	 They	
do	 not	 follow	 anything	 except	
assumption,	 and	 they	 only	 make	
guesses.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sun	lo	beshak	Allāh	hi	ki	milk	haiñ	jitne	
āsmānoñ	 meiñ	 haiñ	 aur	 jitne	 zaminoñ	
meiñ	aur	kāhe	ke	piche	jā	rahe	haiñ	woh	
jo	Allāh	 ke	 siwā	 sharik	 pukār	 rahe	 haiñ	
woh	to	piche	nahiñ	jāte	magar	gumān	ke	
aur	woh to	nahiñ	magar	atkaleñ	daudāte	
(andāze	karte)

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِتَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	created	the	night	for	you	so	
that	you	may	gain	rest	in	it	and	the	day	giving	sight;	indeed	in	this	are	signs	for	the	people	who	
heed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	rāt	banāi	ke	
is	 meiñ	 chain	 pāo	 aur	 din	 banāyā	
tumhāri	āñkheiñ	kholtā	beshak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	sun	ne	wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًۭا ۗ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۖ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ۖ لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنْ عِندَكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ بِهَـٰذَآ ۚ أَتَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Allah has	created	a	son	for	Himself”- Purity	is	to	Him!	He	is	the	Perfect	(Unwanting,	
free of	 needs);	 to	Him	 only	 belongs	 all	 whatever	is	in	 the	 heavens	 and	 all	 whatever	is	in	 the	
earth;	“You	do	not	have	any	proof	of	this;	do	you	say	a	thing	concerning	Allah which	you	do	not	
know?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	Allāh	ne	apne	liye	aulād	banāi	pāki	us	 ko	wohi	be	niyāz	hai	usi	 kā	hai	jo	Kuch	āsmānoñ	
meiñ	hai	aur	jo	kuch	zameen	meiñ	tumhāre	pās	us	ki	koi	bhi	sanad	nahiñ	kyā	Allāh	par	woh	bāt	
batāte	ho	jis	ka	tumheiñ	‘ilm	nahiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ لَا يُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText: Say,	“Indeed	those	who	fabricate	lies	against	Allah will	never	succeed.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo	woh	jo	Allāh	par	jhoot	bāndhte	haiñ	un	kā	bhalā	na	hogā.

arabicText: مَتَـٰعٌۭ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ ثُمَّ نُذِيقُهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلشَّدِيدَ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْفُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Enjoying	a	little	in	the	earth,	they	have	then	to	return	to	Us	- We	will	then	make	them	taste	a	
severe	punishment,	the	recompense	of	their	disbelief.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Dunyā	 meiñ	 kuch	 bar’at	 lena	 (faida	 uthānā)	 hai	 phir	 unheiñ	 hamāri	 taraf	 wāpas	 āanā	 phir	
unheiñ	hum	sakht	‘azāb	chakhāyeñ	ge	badlā	un	ke	kufr	kā.

arabicText: ۞ وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ نُوحٍ إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِن كَانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيْكُم مَّقَامِى وَتَذْكِيرِى بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ فَأَجْمِعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَكُمْ وَشُرَكَآءَكُمْ ثُمَّ لَا يَكُنْ أَمْرُكُمْ عَلَيْكُمْ غُمَّةًۭ ثُمَّ ٱقْضُوٓا۟ إِلَىَّ وَلَا تُنظِرُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Read	to	them	the	story	of	Nooh;	when	he	
told	 his	 people,	 “O	 my	 people	 - if	 my	
standing	 here	 and	 reminding	 you	 of	
Allah’s	signs	have	been	intolerable	for	you	
- so	I	have	trusted	only	Allah - then	work	
jointly	 and	 strengthen	 your	 work	 along	
with	 your	 false	 deities,	 leaving	 no	 doubt	
regarding	 your	 work	- then	 do	 whatever	
you	 can	 to	 me,	 and	 do	 not	 give	 me	
respite.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 unheiñ	 Nūh ki	 khabar	 padh	 kar	
sunāo; jab	us	ne	apni	qaum	se	kahā, “aye	
meri	qaum - agar	tum	par	shāq	(nāgawār)	
guzrā	 hai	 merā	 khadā	 honā	 aur	 Allāh	 ki	
nishaniyañ	 yād	 dilānā	- to	 maiñ ne	 Allāh	
hi	 par	 bharosā	 kiyā	 to	 mil	 kar	 kām	 karo	
aur	 apne	 jhoote	m'aboodoñ	 samait, apnā	
kām	 pakkā	 kar	 lo	 - phir	 tumhāre	 kām	
meiñ	 tum	 par	 kuch	 gunjalak	 (uljhan-oposheedgi)	 na	 rahe	 phir	jo	 ho	 sake	merā	
kar	lo	aur	mujhe	mohlat	na	do”

arabicText: فَإِن تَوَلَّيْتُمْ فَمَا سَأَلْتُكُم مِّنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Then	if	 you	 turn	 away,	 I	 do	 not	 ask	 any	
fee	 from	 you;	 my	 reward	 is	 only	 upon	
Allah,	 and	 I	 am	 commanded	to	 be	 of	 the	
Muslims.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	agar	tum	muñh	phero	to	maiñ	tum	se	
kuch	ujrat	nahiñ	māñgtā	merā	ajr	to	nahiñ	
magar	 Allāh	 par	 aur	 mujhe	 hukm	 hai ke	
maiñ	Musalmānoñ	se	hooñ.

arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ خَلَـٰٓئِفَ وَأَغْرَقْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
In	 response	 they	 denied	 him,	 so	 We	
rescued	 him	 and	 those	 with	 him	 in	 the	
ship,	 and	 made	 them	 caliphs,	 and	 We	
drowned	 those	 who	 denied	 Our	 signs;	
therefore	see	what	sort	of	fate	befell	those	
who	had	been	warned!
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 unhoñ	 ne	 use	jhutlāyā	 to	 hum	 ne	 use	
aur	 jo	 us	 ke	 sāth	 kashti	 meiñ	 the	 un	 ko	
najāt	di	aur	unheiñ	hum	ne	nāib	kiyā	aur	
jinhoñ	 ne	 hamāri Āyateñ	 jhutlāiñ	 un	 ko	
hum	ne	dubo	diyā	to	dekho	darāye	huwoñ	
kā	anjām	kaisa	huw

arabicText: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ رُسُلًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِمْ فَجَآءُوهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَمَا كَانُوا۟ لِيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِمَا كَذَّبُوا۟ بِهِۦ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَطْبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُعْتَدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 after	 him,	 We	 sent	 other	 Noble	
Messengers	to	their	respective	people	- so	
they	 came	 to	 them	with	 clear	 proofs	- so	
they	were	 not	 such	 as	 to	 believe	in	what	
they	had	denied	before;	this	is	how	We	set	
seals	upon	the	hearts	of	rebels.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	 is	 ke	 bad	 aur	 Rasool	 hum	 ne	 un	 ki	
qaumoñ	 ki	 taraf	 bheje	 to	 woh	 un	 ke	 pās	
roushan	dalileñ	laye	to	woh	aise	na	the	ke	
Imān	 lāte	 us	 par	 jise	 pehle	 jhutlā	 chuke	
the	hum	yuñhi	mohar	lagā	dete	haiñ	sarkashoñ	ke	diloñ	par.

arabicText: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ وَهَـٰرُونَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا مُّجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 after	 them,	 We	 sent	 Moosa	 and	
Haroon	 along	 with	 Our	 signs,	 to	 Firaun	
and	 his	 court	 members,	 so	 they	 were	
proud	and	were	a	guilty	people.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	 un	 ke	 b’ad	 hum	 ne	 Mūsā aur	 Hāroon ko	 fir’aon	 aur	 us	 ke darbāriyoñ	 ki	 taraf	 apni	
nishaniyañ	de	kar	bhejā	to	unhoñ	ne	takabbur	kiya	aur	woh	mujrim	log	the

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText: So	when	the	truth	came	to	them	from	Us,	they	said,	“Indeed	this	is	a	clear	magic.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jab	un	ke	pās	hamāri	taraf	se	haq	āyā	bole	yeh	to	zaroor	khulā	jādoo	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَتَقُولُونَ لِلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَكُمْ ۖ أَسِحْرٌ هَـٰذَا وَلَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلسَّـٰحِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“What!	You	speak	in	this	manner	regarding	the	truth	when	it	has	come	to	you?	Is	
this	magic?	And	magicians	never	succeed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā ne	kahā	kyā	haq	ki	nisbat	aeysa	kehte	ho	jab	woh	tumhāre	pās	āayā	kyā	yeh	jādoo	hai	aur	
jādoogar	murād	ko	nahiñ	pahuñchte

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتَلْفِتَنَا عَمَّا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهِ ءَابَآءَنَا وَتَكُونَ لَكُمَا ٱلْكِبْرِيَآءُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا نَحْنُ لَكُمَا بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	 “Have	 you	 two	come	 to	us	 to	revert	us	 from	what	we	 found	our	 fathers	upon,	and	
that	 the	 leadership	 in	 the	 land	 may	 only	 be	 for	 you	 two?	 And	 we	 shall	 never	 believe	 in	 you	
both.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	kyā	tum	hamāre	pās	is	liye	āaye	ho	ke	hameiñ	is	se	pher	do	jis	par	hum	ne	apne	bāp	dādā	
ko	pāyā	aur	zameen	meiñ	tumheiñ	donoñ	ki		badāi	rahe	aur	hum	tum	par	Imān	lāne	ke	nahiñ

arabicText: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱئْتُونِى بِكُلِّ سَـٰحِرٍ عَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 Firaun	 said,	 “Bring	 every	 expert	
magician	to	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 fir’aon	bolā	har	jādoogar	ilm	wāle	ko	
mere	pās	le	āo

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	 the	magicians	 came,	Moosa	 said	
to	 them,	 “Cast	 whatever	 you	 intend	 to	
cast.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	jādoogar	āye	un	se	Mūsā ne	kahā	
dālo	jo	tumheiñ	dālnā	hai.

arabicText: فَلَمَّآ أَلْقَوْا۟ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ مَا جِئْتُم بِهِ ٱلسِّحْرُ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَيُبْطِلُهُۥٓ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُصْلِحُ عَمَلَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	 when	 they	 had	 cast,	 Moosa	
said,	 “This	 what	 you	 have	 brought,	 is	
magic;	Allah will	now	make	it	void;	indeed	
Allah does	 not	 make	 the	 works	 of	 the	
mischievous	successful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	unhoñ	ne	dālā	Mūsā ne	kahā	yeh	
jo	 tum	 lāye	 yeh	 jādoo	 hai	 ab	 Allāh	 use	
bātil	 kar	 degā	 Allāh	 mufsidoñ	 kā	 kām	
nahiñ	banātā.

arabicText: وَيُحِقُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحَقَّ بِكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 Allah will	 prove	 the	 truth	 by	 His	
Words,	even	if	the	guilty	get	annoyed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 apni	 bātoñ	 se	 haq	 ko	 haq	 kar	
dikhātā	hai	pade	burā	māneñ	mujrim.

arabicText: فَمَآ ءَامَنَ لِمُوسَىٰٓ إِلَّا ذُرِّيَّةٌۭ مِّن قَوْمِهِۦ عَلَىٰ خَوْفٍۢ مِّن فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِمْ أَن يَفْتِنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ لَعَالٍۢ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	none	accepted	faith	in	Moosa,	except	a	
few	 descendants	 of	 his	 people,	 fearing	
Firaun	 and	 his	 court	 members,	 that	 they	
would	 force	 them	 to	 revert;	 and	 indeed	
Firaun	was	a	rebel	in	the	land;	and	indeed	
he	crossed	the	limits.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 Mūsā par	 Imān	 na	 lāye	 magar	 us	 ki	
qaum	 ki	 aulād	 se	 kuch	 log	 fir’aun	 aur	 us	
ke	 darbāriyoñ	 se	 darte	 huwe	 ke	 kahiñ	
unheiñ	hatne	par	majboor	na	kar	deiñ	aur	
beshak	 fir’aun	 zameen	 meiñ	 sar	 uthāne	
wālā	 thā	 aur	 beshak	 woh	 had	 se	 guzar	
gayā.

arabicText: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِن كُنتُمْ ءَامَنتُم بِٱللَّهِ فَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلُوٓا۟ إِن كُنتُم مُّسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	Moosa	said,	“O	my	people!	If	you	have	
accepted	 faith	 in	 Allah,	 then	 you	 should	
rely	only	upon	Him,	if	you	are	Muslims.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Mūsā ne	 kahā	 aye	 meri	 qaum	 agar	
tum	 Allāh	 par	 Imān	 lāye	 to	 usi	 par	
bharosa	karo	agar	islām	rakhte	ho

arabicText: فَقَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “We	 have	 relied	 only	 upon	
Allah;	 Our	 Lord!	 Do	 not	make	 us	 a	 test	 *	
for	 the	 unjust	 people.”	(*	 By	 giving	 them	
power	over	us.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	hum	ne	Allāh	hi	par	bharosā	kyā	ilāhi	
hum	 ko	 zālim	 logoñ	 ke	 liye	 āzmāish	 na	
banā.

arabicText: وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	with	Your	mercy,	rescue	us	from	the	
disbelievers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 apni	 rahmat	 farmā	 kar	 hameiñ	
kāfiroñ	se	najāt	de

arabicText: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَأَخِيهِ أَن تَبَوَّءَا لِقَوْمِكُمَا بِمِصْرَ بُيُوتًۭا وَٱجْعَلُوا۟ بُيُوتَكُمْ قِبْلَةًۭ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	sent	the	divine	revelation	to	Moosa	and	his	brother	that,	“Build	houses	for	your	people	
in	Egypt	and	make	your	houses	as	places	of	worship,	and	keep	the	prayer	established,	and	give	
glad	tidings	to	the	Muslims.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hum	ne	Mūsā aur	us	ke	bhāi	ko	wahi	bheji	ke	misr	meiñ	apni	qaum	ke	liye	makānāt	banāo	
aur	 apne	 gharoñ	 ko	 Namāz	 ki	 jagah	 karo	 aur	 namāz	 qāim	 rakho	 aur	 Musalmānoñ	 ko	
khushkhabri	sunā

arabicText: قَالَ قَدْ أُجِيبَت دَّعْوَتُكُمَا فَٱسْتَقِيمَا وَلَا تَتَّبِعَآنِّ سَبِيلَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “The	 prayer	 of	 you	 two	 is	
accepted,	 therefore	 remain	 firm,	 and	 do	
not	follow	the	way	of	the	unwise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Farmāyā	tum	donoñ	ki	du’ā	qubool	hui	to	
sābit	 qadam	 raho	 aur	nādānoñ	 ki	 rāh	 na	
chalo

arabicText: ۞ وَجَـٰوَزْنَا بِبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ بَغْيًۭا وَعَدْوًا ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَدْرَكَهُ ٱلْغَرَقُ قَالَ ءَامَنتُ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِىٓ ءَامَنَتْ بِهِۦ بَنُوٓا۟ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 transported	 the	 Descendants	 of	
Israel	across	the	sea,	therefore	Firaun	and	
his	army	pursued	them	with	rebellion	and	
injustice;	 until	 when	 the	 drowning	
overcame	him	he	cried,	“I	accept	faith	that	
there	 is	 no	 True	 God	 except	 the	 One	 in	
Whom	 the	 Descendants	 of	 Israel	 believe,	
and	I	am	a	Muslim.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hum	bani	Isra’il	ko	daryā	pāar	le	gaye	
to	 fir’aun	 aur	 us	 ke	 lashkaroñ	 ne	 un	 kā	
picha	kiyā	sarkashi	aur	zulm	se	yahāñ	tak	
ke	 jab	 use	 doobne	 ne	 āliya	 bolā	 maiñ	
Imān	 lāyā	 ke	 koi	 sacha	 m’abood	 nahiñ	
siwā	us	ke	jis	par	bani	Israil	Imān	laye	aur	
maiñ	Musalmān	hooñ.

arabicText: ءَآلْـَٔـٰنَ وَقَدْ عَصَيْتَ قَبْلُ وَكُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“What!	 Now?*	 Whereas	 you	 were	
disobedient	 from	 the	 start	 and	 you	 were	
mischievous!”	(This	 was	 said	 to	 Firaun.	 *	
Accepting	faith	at	the	time	of	death	is	of	no	
use.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	 ab	 aur	 pehle	 se	 nā	 farmān	 rahā	 aur	
too	fasādi	thā

arabicText: فَٱلْيَوْمَ نُنَجِّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكُونَ لِمَنْ خَلْفَكَ ءَايَةًۭ ۚ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا لَغَـٰفِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“This	 day	We	 shall	 salvage	 your	 body	 so	
that	you	may	be	a	sign	for	those	after	you;	
and	indeed	most	 people	 are	 neglectful	 of	
Our	signs.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āaj	 Hum	 teri	 lāsh	 ko	 utrā	 deiñ	 (bāqi	
rakheiñ)	 ge	 ke	 too	 apne	 pichloñ	 ke	 liye	
nishāni	ho	aur	beshak	log	Hamāri	Āyatoñ	
se	ghāfil	haiñ

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ بَوَّأْنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ مُبَوَّأَ صِدْقٍۢ وَرَزَقْنَـٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ فَمَا ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعِلْمُ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	provided	the	Descendants	
of	 Israel	a	place	of	honour,	and	bestowed	
good	 sustenance	 to	 them;	 and	 they	 did	
not	 fall	 into	 dispute	 except	 after	 the	
knowledge	 had	 come	 to	 them;	 indeed	
your	Lord	will	judge	between	them	on	the	
Day	 of	 Resurrection	 concerning	 the	
matters	in	which	they	used	to	differ.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	beshak	hum	ne	bani	Isra’il	ko	izzat ki	
jagha	 di	 aur	 unheiñ	 suthri	 rozi	 atā	 ki	 to	
ikhtilāf	 meiñ	 nā	 pade	 magar	 ilm	 āane	 ke	
b’ād	beshak	tumhārā	Rab	Qiyāmat	ke	din	
un	 meiñ	 faislā	 kar	 dega	 jis	 bāt	 meiñ	
jhagadte	the.

arabicText: فَإِن كُنتَ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّمَّآ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ فَسْـَٔلِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَقْرَءُونَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ مِن قَبْلِكَ ۚ لَقَدْ جَآءَكَ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُمْتَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you,	O	listener,	have	any	doubt	in	what	We	have	sent	down	towards	you,	then	question	
those	who	have	read	the	Book	before	you;	undoubtedly,	towards	you	has	come	the	truth	from	
your	Lord,	therefore	do	not	be	of	those	who	doubt.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aye	 sunne	 wāle	 agar	 tujhe	 kuch	
shubah	ho	us	meiñ	jo	hum	ne	teri	taraf	utārā	to	un	se	pooñch	dekh	jo	tujh	se	pehle	kitāb	parhne	
wāle	heiñ	beshak	tere	pas	tere	Rab	ki	taraf	se	Haq	āayā	to	tu	har	giz	shak	wāloñ	meiñ	na	ho.

arabicText: وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	never	be	of	those	who	denied	the	signs	of	Allah,	for	you	will	then	be	of	the	losers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	har	giz	un	meiñ	na	honā	jinhoñ	ne	Allāh	ki	Āyateiñ	jhutlāyeiñ	ke	tu	khasāre	wāloñ	meiñ	ho	
jāega

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ حَقَّتْ عَلَيْهِمْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	those	for	whom	the	Word	of	your	Lord	has	proved	true,	will	not	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText: Beshak	woh	jin	par	tere	Rab	ki	bāt	thik	padh	chuki	hai	Imān	na	lāeñge

arabicText: وَلَوْ جَآءَتْهُمْ كُلُّ ءَايَةٍ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
englishTranslationText: Even	if	every	sign	comes	to	them,	until	they	witness	the	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Agarche	sab	nishaniyañ	un	ke	pās	āyeñ	jab	tak	dard-nāk	‘azāb	na	dekh	leiñ

arabicText: فَلَوْلَا كَانَتْ قَرْيَةٌ ءَامَنَتْ فَنَفَعَهَآ إِيمَـٰنُهَآ إِلَّا قَوْمَ يُونُسَ لَمَّآ ءَامَنُوا۟ كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْخِزْىِ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمَتَّعْنَـٰهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	 if	 only	 had	 there	 been	 one	 dwelling	 *	
that	 believed	 and	 its	 belief	 would	 have	
benefited	 it	- except	 the	 nation	 of	 Yunus	
(Jonah)!	 When	 they	 accepted	 faith,	 We	
removed	 the	 disgraceful	 punishment	 in	
the	 life	 of	 this	 world	 from	 them,	 and	 let	
them	 enjoy	 for	 a	 while.	 (*	 That	 was	
destroyed	after	being	warned.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 huwi	 hoti	 na	 koi	 basti	 ke	Imān	lāti	 to	
us	kā	Imān	kām	ātā	hāñ	Yūnus ki	qaum	jab	
Imān	 lāye	 hum	 ne	 un	 se	 ruswāi	 kā	 ‘azāb	
dunyā	 ki	 zindagi	 meiñ	 hatā	 diyā	 aur	 ek	
waqt	tak	unheiñ	baratne	diyā.

arabicText: وَلَوْ شَآءَ رَبُّكَ لَـَٔامَنَ مَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ كُلُّهُمْ جَمِيعًا ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُكْرِهُ ٱلنَّاسَ حَتَّىٰ يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	your	Lord	willed,	all	those	who	are	
in	 the	 earth	 - everyone	 of	 them	 - would	
have	 accepted	 faith;	 so	 will	 you	 (O	 dear	
Prophet	Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	
be	 upon	 him)	 force	 the	 people	 until	 they	
become	Muslims?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 tumhārā	 Rab	 chāhtā	 zameen	
meiñ	jitne	heiñ	sab	 ke	sab	 Imān	le	āte	 to	
kyā	 tum	 logoñ	 ko	 zabardasti	 karoge	
yahāñ	tak	ke	Musalmān	ho	jāeiñ.

arabicText: وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفْسٍ أَن تُؤْمِنَ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَيَجْعَلُ ٱلرِّجْسَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	no	soul	can	accept	faith	except	by	the	
command	 of	 Allah;	 and	 He	 sets	 the	
punishment	upon	 those	who	do	not	have	
sense.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kisi	jān	ki	qudrat	nahiñ	ke	Imān	le	āye	
magar	Allāh	ke	hukm	se	aur	‘azāb	un	par	
dālta	hai	jinheiñ	aql	nahiñ.

arabicText: قُلِ ٱنظُرُوا۟ مَاذَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَا تُغْنِى ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتُ وَٱلنُّذُرُ عَن قَوْمٍۢ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Observe	what	is	in	the	heavens	
and	 the	 earth”;	 and	 the	 signs	 and	 the	
Noble	 Messengers	 do	 not	 benefit	 the	
people	who	are	not	destined	to	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	 farmāo	 dekho	āsmānoñ	aur	zameen	
meiñ	 kyā	 kyā	 hai	 aur	 āyateiñ	 aur	 Rasool	
unheiñ	 kuch	 nahiñ	 dete	 jin	 ke	 naseeb	
meiñ	Imān	nahiñ

arabicText: فَهَلْ يَنتَظِرُونَ إِلَّا مِثْلَ أَيَّامِ ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوْا۟ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ فَٱنتَظِرُوٓا۟ إِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُنتَظِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	 what	 are	 they	 waiting	 for,	 except	 the	
days	 similar	 to	 the	 days	 of	 those	 who	
passed	 away	 before	 them?	 Say,	 “Then	
wait!	I	too	am	waiting	with	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 unheiñ	 kāhe	 kā	 intiżār	 hai	 magar	
unhiñ	logoñ	ke	se	dinoñ	kā	jo	un	se	pehle	
ho	guzre	tum	farmāo	to	intiżār	karo	maiñ	
bhi	tumhāre	sāth	intiżār	meiñ	hooñ

arabicText: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّى رُسُلَنَا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ حَقًّا عَلَيْنَا نُنجِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	We	shall	save	Our	Noble	Messengers	
and	 the	 believers	 - this	 is	 it;	 it	 is	
incumbent	 upon	 Our	 mercy	 to	 save	 the	
Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	hum	apne	Rasooloñ	aur	 Imān	wāloñ	
ko	 najāt	 deiñ	 ge	 bāt	 yahi	 hai	 hamāre	
zimma-e-karam	 par	 haq	 hai	Musalmānoñ	
ko	najāt	dena.

arabicText: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِن كُنتُمْ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّن دِينِى فَلَآ أَعْبُدُ ٱلَّذِينَ تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَـٰكِنْ أَعْبُدُ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِى يَتَوَفَّىٰكُمْ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	(O	 dear	 Prophet	Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him),	 “O	 people!	 If	 you	 are	in	
doubt	concerning	my	religion,	then	(know	that)	I	will	never	worship	those	whom you	worship	
instead	of	Allah - but	I	worship	Allah Who	will	give	you	death;	and	I	am	commanded	to	be	of	the	
believers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo	 aye	logoñ	 agar	 tum	mere	 din	 ki	 taraf	 se	 kisi	 shubeh	meiñ	 ho	 to	maiñ	 to	 use	 na	
poojuñga	jise	tum	Allāh	ke	siwā	poojte	ho	hān	us	Allāh	ko	poojtā	hooñ	jo	tumhāri	jān	nikāle	gā	
aur	mujhe	hukm	hai	ke	Imān	wāloñ	meiñ	huñ.

arabicText: وَأَنْ أَقِمْ وَجْهَكَ لِلدِّينِ حَنِيفًۭا وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	that	‘Set	your	face	straight	*	for	religion,	apart	from	all	others;	and	never	be	of	those	who	
ascribe	partners	(to	Allah)’.”	(*	Your	intention	sincerely	for	religion.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh	ke	apnā	muñh	din	ke	liye	seedhā	rakh	sab	se	alag	ho	kar	aur	hargiz	shirk	wāloñ	meiñ	
na	honā.

arabicText: وَلَا تَدْعُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكَ وَلَا يَضُرُّكَ ۖ فَإِن فَعَلْتَ فَإِنَّكَ إِذًۭا مِّنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	other	than	Allah,	do	not	worship	that	which	cannot	benefit	you	nor	cause	you	harm;	then	
if	you	do	so,	you	would	be	of	the	unjust.”	(*	Some	things	like	the	sun,	stars,	trees	are	useful	but	
they	too	are	created	by Allah.	Their	worship	will	not	benefit	- in	fact	it	is	harmful.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	Allāh	ke	siwā	us	ki	bandagi	na	kar	jo	terā	na	bhalā	kar	sake	na	burā	phir	agar	aisa	kare	to	us	
waqt	tu	zālimoñ	se	hogā.

arabicText: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ قَدْ جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُّ عَلَيْهَا ۖ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ عَلَيْكُم بِوَكِيلٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“O	people!	The	truth	*	has	come	to	you	from	
your	 Lord;	 so	 whoever	 came	 to	 guidance,	 has	
come	 to	 guidance	 for	 his	 own	 benefit;	 and	
whoever	strayed,	has	strayed	 for	his	own	harm;	
and	 I	 am	 not	 a	 trustee	 over	 you.”	 (*	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him,	or	
Islam	or	the	Qur’an.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	farmāo	aye	logo	tumhāre	pās	tumhāre	Rab	
ki	taraf	haq	āyā	to	jo	rāh	par	āyā	woh	apne	bhale	
ko	 rāh	 par	 āyā	 aur	jo	 behkā	woh	 apne	 bure	 ko	
behkā	 aur	 kuch	 maiñ	 tum	 par	 kadodā	
(nigehbān)	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَٱتَّبِعْ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ وَٱصْبِرْ حَتَّىٰ يَحْكُمَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	 and	
blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 follow	 what	 is	 divinely	
revealed	 to	 you,	 and	 have	 patience	 till	 Allah
gives	His	command;	and	He	is	the	Best	of	Rulers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 us	 par	 chalo	 jo	 tum	 par	 wahi	 hoti	 hai	 aur	
sabr	karo	yahāñ	tak	ke	Allāh	hukm	farmāye	aur	
woh	sab	se	behtar	hukm	farmāne	wālā	hai.
